Legal_Issue: Whether the trademark 'EXISTENCE' was in use in Canada as required by s. 44 of the Trade Marks Act?
Evidence_Assessment: Single bona fide sale of four jars of face cream; advertising evidence; bankruptcy of distributor considered but not proven sufficient to excuse nonuse
Burden_of_Proof: On appellant to demonstrate use or special circumstances excusing nonuse
Credibility_Factor: Bona fide sale and supporting advertising established credibility of use
Legal_Rule: Under s. 44, a trademark must be in use in Canada or have special circumstances excusing nonuse to avoid expungement
Standard_of_Review: Reasonableness or correctness in administrative appeal context
Outcome_on_Merits: Appellant proved sufficient use under s. 44
Review_Standard: Assessment of whether use meets statutory requirements under s. 44
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Opportunity to present additional evidence on appeal
Key_Evidence_Considered: Sale of four jars of face cream; advertising materials; distributor’s bankruptcy
Legal_Framework: Canadian Trade Marks Act, administrative and appellate procedures
Applicant_Challenge: Charme et Beauté Lise Watier Inc. requested expungement
Legal_Rule_Source: Section 44 of the Trade Marks Act
Defendant_Response: Demonstrated use through sale and advertising; invoked special circumstances due to distributor bankruptcy
Evidence_Type: Direct evidence of sale; circumstantial evidence of advertising
Claimant_Status: Charme et Beauté Lise Watier Inc. as applicant for expungement
Applicable_Process: Administrative appeal with judicial review elements
Governing_Rule: s. 44 requires use in Canada or special circumstances for continued registration
